text:
Kincaid is a city in Anderson County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 122 people lived there.
History.
Kincaid was created in 1885. It was named after Robert Kincaid, of Mound City.
Geography.
Kincaid is at (38.083502, -95.153612). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 122 people, 56 households, and 30 families living in Kincaid.
Government.
The Kincaid has a mayor and five council members. The council meets the 2nd Monday of each month at 7PM.
Education.
Kincaid is part of Unified School District 479.
